title: Moped gangs targeting London cyclists with high-end bicycles
description: Hackney was named the worst borough for bike theft, after a total of 896 bikes were reported stolen in the east London borough between January and July in 2023. The Clean Cities Campaign, which carried out the research that was published last November, said more than 50 bikes a day were reported stolen across the capital.

title: Lib Dems call for extra £1bn for farming budget in bid to win rural votes
description: The party is also calling for ‘arbitrary’ visa salary thresholds to be abandoned in order to help plug workforce gaps in the food sector.

title: Lib Dems select their Redditch prospective parliamentary candidate
description: THE LIBERAL Democrats have selected their Redditch Prospective Parliamentary Candidate for the upcoming general election. Andrew Fieldsend-Roxborough lives in the town with his wife and works as an engineer for the National Grid. He said it was an ...

title: Voters are tougher on immigration than all of the main political parties and back policies often seen as the preserve of the Right, poll finds
description: A survey of more than 13,000 adults found that almost two-thirds want more restrictions on immigration, including slim majorities of Labour and Liberal Democrat voters.

title: I have your back, Rishi Sunak tells farmers at NFU conference
description: Sunak becomes first PM to address conference since Gordon Brown in 2008, as part of courting of farming sector

title: How are late-night hosts handling Biden’s age?
description: With the US election looming, comedians are grappling with how much to reference Joe Biden’s age without wider pushback

title: Scholars who ranked Trump 'worst ever president' SLAMMED for 'liberal bias' by polling academic group that's 'barely distinguishable from the Democratic Party and its far-left ...
description: Social media users pounced on the results, accusing the academics of polling only a small group of experts with a shared outlook that's increasingly at odds with regular Americans.

title: Lib Dems fight to save Telford/Roseburn Path
description: Following a recent Transport and Environment Committee meeting, the next phase of the tram project was agreed upon. A concerning point about this is that one of the suggested routes in the Roseburn-Telford path.

title: York Lib Dem leader calls North Yorkshire councillor's anti-Semitic comments "appalling"
description: The leader of York Liberal Democrats has labelled anit-Semitic comments a North Yorkshire councillor in the same party made as “appalling.” Coun Pat Marsh, who chairs the Harrogate and Knaresborough area constituency committee, was suspended from the Liberal Democrats after she tweeted various anti-Semitic comments.

title: 'Some people said it was like turkeys voting for Christmas... they were right'
description: Hannah, 34, said: “Some people said it was like turkeys voting for Christmas, and they were right. Me? I didn’t vote Conservative and I never will. Why people thought the Conservatives would do anything for Leigh is beyond me.”

title: Tory minister Maria Caulfield gives bizarre excuse for not handing back £8,000 pay-off
description: Tory Health Minister Maria Caulfield pocketed thousands of pounds in severance pay despite returning to the same job just seven weeks later - and she has refused to give it back

title: Inspections on water companies to quadruple ‘to end routine lawbreaking’
description: Inspections on water companies will quadruple over the next year in a bid to crack down on pollution by firms, the Government has announced. The measures to increase checks include up to 500 additional Environment Agency staff for inspections,
